signs.title: Common signs
signs.moodText: People with depression often experience persistent low mood that cannot simply be “shaken off.” Feelings of hopelessness, inner emptiness, or worthlessness may strongly affect everyday life. Irritability and reduced resilience can also occur. This mood typically lasts for a longer period of time.
signs.energyText: Many people lose interest in things they used to enjoy-such as hobbies, social contact, or everyday activities. At the same time, strong exhaustion is common. Even small tasks can feel overwhelming, and starting or managing daily routines may become difficult.
signs.sleepText: Depression can also show up physically. This includes sleep problems such as difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, waking up early, or sleeping too much. Appetite changes, concentration difficulties, or physical complaints without a clear medical cause may also occur.

whatIs.title: What is depression?
whatIs.text: Depression is more than “feeling sad.” It can affect mood, thoughts, the body, and behavior over a longer period of time and can significantly impact everyday life. Many people feel restricted by it-important to know: depression is common and treatable.
bullets: It can affect anyone-regardless of age, job, or life situation.
It results from a combination of biological, psychological, and social factors.
There are effective treatments and many ways to get support.
whatIs.selfCheckText: A self-check does not replace a diagnosis—but it can be a sign that seeking help might be useful.
whatIs.helloBetterText: HelloBetter is a digital platform offering evidence-based online therapy programs for mental health concerns such as stress, depression, anxiety, and sleep problems. The programs teach proven CBT techniques, work via app and web, include support from psychological coaches, and some are available in Germany as a digital health application (DiGA) by prescription.
